title: [Large-Scale] Unstructured Problem Solving and Psychomotor Skill Enhancement Program Using Web-Based Constructivist Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of job-related basic technical skills and practical experience
context.additional_context: Social sector competency enhancement program conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze unstructured job-related problems and propose solutions with over 80% engagement in a web-based constructivist environment.
Learners can improve psychomotor skills (manual dexterity, manipulation ability) by over 30% through simulation/VR-based activities.
Learners can refine problem-solving strategies by exchanging peer feedback at least three times in a collaborative learning center.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
